pull.title: test: Log IP of download server in get_previous_releases.py
pull.body: In order to help debug issues with previous release downloads from our web server, we need to know which IP the downloader connected to.

events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Code Coverage & Benchmarks For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/34045. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | ACK | [l0rinc](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34045#pullrequestreview-3564697400), [janb84](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34045#pullrequestreview-3566682091), [rkrux](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34045#pullrequestreview-3566844824), [fjahr](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34045#issuecomment-3642318494), [glozow](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34045#pullrequestreview-3568330031) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore.

events.message: test: Log IP of download server in get_previous_releases.py

events.body:
ACK cdaf25f9c3e56b4e80b90a471bdc0a175160534c

Thanks for incorporating my suggestion.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -122,6 +123,9 @@ def progress_hook(progress_bytes, total_size):
         if response.status != 200:
             raise RuntimeError(f"HTTP request failed with status code: {response.status}")
 
+        sock_info = socket.fromfd(response.fileno(), socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM).getpeername()
comments.body:
Are the server IP addresses always IPv4  ? `Socket.AF_INET` is ipv4 only  

Yes it works but give wrong ipv6 address :

```terminal
Connected to 2620:6e:a004:1:30b4:de03:100:0

Connected to 2620:6e:a004:1::b1c:c05e

dig AAAA bitcoincore.org
bitcoincore.org.        3063    IN      AAAA    2620:6e:a004:1::b1c:c05e
```

```python
        sock_info = response.fp.raw._sock .getpeername()
        print(f"Connected to {sock_info[0]}")
```

This works (second answer) but is not the highest of quality code.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -122,6 +123,9 @@ def progress_hook(progress_bytes, total_size):
         if response.status != 200:
             raise RuntimeError(f"HTTP request failed with status code: {response.status}")
 
+        sock_info = socket.fromfd(response.fileno(), socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM).getpeername()
comments.body: No, it can be IPv6. But since we aren't ever going to actually use this socket, `AF_INET` doesn't matter. The logging still works correctly with IPv6.

         if response.status != 200:
             raise RuntimeError(f"HTTP request failed with status code: {response.status}")
 
+        sock_info = socket.fromfd(response.fileno(), socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM).getpeername()
comments.body: oke, thanks, please validate that it returns the correct ipv6 addresses, see my edit :) happy to be wrong

         if response.status != 200:

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -18,6 +18,7 @@
 import re
 import shutil
 import subprocess
+import socket

@@ -18,6 +18,7 @@
 import re
 import shutil
 import subprocess
+import socket

@@ -122,6 +122,9 @@ def progress_hook(progress_bytes, total_size):
         if response.status != 200:
             raise RuntimeError(f"HTTP request failed with status code: {response.status}")
 
+        sock_info = response.fp.raw._sock.getpeername()
+        print(f"Connected to {sock_info[0]}")
comments.body:
I'm fine with this as well, alternatively to document what we're connecting to, we could unpack the `ip` from the `(host, port)`/`(host, port, flowinfo, scope_id)` tuples with something like:
```suggestion
        ip, *_ = response.fp.raw._sock.getpeername()
        print(f"Connected to {ip}")
```
or
```suggestion
        ip = response.fp.raw._sock.getpeername()[0]
        print(f"Connected to {ip}")
```
